com.netflix.genie.web.services.impl

Class DiskJobFileServiceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.genie.web.services.impl.DiskJobFileServiceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JobFileService

    public class DiskJobFileServiceImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements JobFileService
    A local disk based implementation of the JobFileService interface.
    Since:
    4.0.0

        public void createJobDirectory(java.lang.String jobId)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Create the root of the job directory for the given job.
        Specified by:
        createJobDirectory in interface JobFileService
        Parameters:
        jobId - The id of the job to create the directory for
        Throws:

      • getJobDirectoryFileState

        public java.util.Set<JobFileState> getJobDirectoryFileState(java.lang.String jobId,
                                                            boolean calculateMd5)
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Given a job id this API will traverse the job directory (if it exists) and return the set of all the files including their relative paths from the directory root, the files' size and optionally a MD5 hash of the file contents.
        Specified by:
        getJobDirectoryFileState in interface JobFileService
        Parameters:
        jobId - The id of the job to get the job directory state for
        calculateMd5 - Whether to calculate the MD5 of the files or not. If true this will slow performance.
        Returns:
        The set of JobFileState metadata records for all files in the directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On error reading the directory

      • updateFile

        public void updateFile(java.lang.String jobId,
                       java.lang.String relativePath,
                       long startByte,
                       byte[] data)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Given a job id and a relative path for a file for that job write the data provided into the file.
        Specified by:
        updateFile in interface JobFileService
        Parameters:
        jobId - The id of the job this log file data belongs to
        relativePath - The relative path (from the log directory root) this file exists at
        startByte - The starting byte of the data
        data - The actual data to be written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On error writing the data to the given file

      • getJobFileAsResource

        public org.springframework.core.io.Resource getJobFileAsResource(java.lang.String jobId,
                                                                 @Nullable
                                                                 java.lang.String relativePath)
        Given the expected path of a job resource (file or directory) for a given job return a Resource handle for this location. A Resource has an Resource.exists() method that should be called to ensure the underlying locations exists or not. No guarantee is made by implementations of this method that the actual location exists.

        Resource should not be written to outside the control of this service. In the future this access may be cut off.

        Specified by:
        getJobFileAsResource in interface JobFileService
        Parameters:
        jobId - The id of the job to get the log file resource for
        relativePath - The relative path of the log file from the root of the given jobs' log directory
        Returns:
        The resource which may or may not actually exist. Use Resource.exists()

      • deleteJobFile

        public void deleteJobFile(java.lang.String jobId,
                          java.lang.String relativePath)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Given a job id this API will delete the entire file from the job directory this service implementation is managing. If the job file doesn't actually exist this is a no-op.
        Specified by:
        deleteJobFile in interface JobFileService
        Parameters:
        jobId - The id of the job to delete a file for
        relativePath - The relative path from the root of the job directory to delete
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On error deleting the file
